posts.post_content:
With Training Grounds, you can level him to Level 5, Turn 5, with no mana-ramp. That said, it'd be nice to use a little ramp via [Everflowing Chalice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Everflowing Chalice) or some other means to get him out quicker. His ability is awesome though. These levelers aren't meant to just be thrown in a deck to win games with (I'm looking at you, Allies)  
  
Things that make a good levelers deck:  
[Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds), [Venerated Teacher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venerated Teacher), [Drake Umbras](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drake Umbras), and/or other Umbras, Mana Accel, [Emerge Unscathed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emerge Unscathed).  
  
What will be neat about these cards is that you can make whatever color leveler deck you want, which makes for good variety and good magic.

posts.post_content:
Expecting to max out a level is just dumb.  
You're not going to regardless, that's not the point of a level up creature.  
They're decent enough vanilla dorks that give you options.  
  
Riding a [Felidar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185743)
